name: Agile Software Development Model for efficient Product Feature delivery

people.name: Engineering stakeholder
people.description: Engineering Team member who follows the software development process to become more efficient

people.name: Product stakeholder
people.description: Product Team member who owns and drives the product vision

softwareSystems.name: Agile Software Development Model for efficient Product Feature delivery
softwareSystems.description: The process used to develop and deliver product features

containers.name: Knowledge Base
containers.description: Centralized repository of information and best practices that the team can refer to for guidance, problem-solving, and knowledge sharing.

components.name: Knowledge Base
components.description: A centralised repository for all the project documentation

components.name: Living Documentation
components.description: Documentation that is co-located with the code and is updated as the code changes

containers.name: Align and Understand Product Requirements
containers.description: Align our focus with the organisation's business model, the needs of its users, and its short, medium, and long-term goals.

components.name: Map the Big Picture
components.description: Describe the User journey through the Product telling a story from the perspective of the end user

relationships.description: formulate user stories and create the project backlog

components.technology: Spreading domain knowledge through the whole team will create a shared understanding of the system to build.

components.name: Product Backlog
components.description: Prioritised list of User Stories that need to be completed or addressed during the project
components.technology: They typically follow the template: As a [user type/role], I want [a capability] so that [benefit or goal]

components.name: Product Brief
components.description: Short product or feature brief to frame and constrain the project. Identifies key capabilities and high level goals and objectives of the project

containers.name: Strategic Architecture and Domain Driven Design
containers.description: Decompose a large problem domain into cohesive modules. Explore models in a creative collaboration of domain experts and software engineers.

components.name: Software Design
components.description: Create models using a common set of abstractions to describe the static structure of a software system

components.name: Domain Decomposition
components.description: Decompose a large problem domain into cohesive modules, so that we can identify stragically significant key focus areas

components.name: Strategic Architecture
components.description: Document Bounded Contexts, from naming to responsibilities alongside its public interface and dependencies

containers.name: Behavior Driven Development
containers.description: Define and understand the desired system behavior before writting any code. It encourages collaboration and a shared understanding of the project's objectives

components.name: Acceptance Tests
components.description: Once we have identified our rules and examples from our discovery sessions, we can now formulate each example as structured documentation.
components.technology: Executable specifications of the system behavior

components.name: Specification Workshop
components.description: Concrete rules and examples help us explore the problem domain and makes a great basis for our acceptance tests
components.technology: Example Mapping sessions to clarify and confirm the acceptance criteria

components.name: Feature files
components.description: Groups related scenarios that demostrates how a feature works

containers.name: Test Driven Development
containers.description: Acceptance Tests guide our code implementation using lower-level examples of the behavior of internal system components.

components.name: Continuous Integration
components.description: Automated build scripts are used to run tests and provide immediate feedback to developers about the status of their code changes

components.name: Test Driven Development
components.description: Lower-level examples of the behavior of internal system components

containers.name: Agile Product Management
containers.description: Agile projects are broken down into two-week iterations which result in a potentially shippable product increment

components.name: Agile Iterations
components.description: Agile ceremonies, metrics and feedback loops to help the team make informed decisions

components.name: Information Radiators
components.description: Project progress and potential issues are visible to all team members with information radiators
components.technology: Scrum and Kanban boards Jira, Miro, etc

components.name: Customer Support
components.description: The process of providing assistance to the end users of the product

sections.content:
# Agile Software Development Model for efficient Product Feature delivery

## Context

The Agile Software Development Model for efficient Product Feature delivery is a dynamic and iterative approach to delivering 
product features in a rapid and flexible manner.

The model is based on the Agile principles and is designed to be used by software development teams to deliver Product
Features in an efficient manner. Rooted in collaboration, adaptability, and customer feedback, it emphasizes iterative
development cycles, typically lasting 1-4 weeks. 

Teams work closely together, including developers, designers, and domain experts, to prioritize tasks and deliver 
incremental value with each iteration. Continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) practices ensure that new 
features are regularly integrated into the product, allowing for swift feedback and adaptation.

Through frequent retrospectives, teams reflect on their process, identifying areas for improvement and
adjusting their approach accordingly. This iterative cycle fosters a responsive and customer-centric development
environment, where product features are delivered efficiently, meeting evolving user needs and market demands.

![](embed:Context)

## Containers

![](embed:Containers)

## Components

![](embed:Components)

## Behavior Driven Development

Specification workshop is a technique used to elicit and define requirements for software systems. 
It is a collaborative approach that brings together stakeholders from different areas of the business to discuss and 
agree on the behavior of the system. 
The goal is to create a shared understanding of the system's requirements and to identify any potential issues early in 
the development process.

[Gojko](https://gojko.net/2008/11/12/specification-workshops-an-agile-way-to-get-better-requirements/)

### Example Mapping

- See [youtube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VwvrGfWmG_U)
- See [cucumber.io](https://cucumber.io/blog/bdd/example-mapping-introduction/)

decisions.content:
# 1. Record architecture decisions

Date: 2024-01-21

## Status

Accepted

## Context

We need to record the architectural decisions made on this project.

## Decision

We will use Architecture Decision Records, as described by Michael Nygard in this article: [http://thinkrelevance.com/blog/2011/11/15/documenting-architecture-decisions](http://thinkrelevance.com/blog/2011/11/15/documenting-architecture-decisions)

## Consequences

See Michael Nygard's article, linked above.
decisions.title: Record architecture decisions
